perturbation.original_text:
1.2. Development Fees. As payment for Developer’s satisfactory performance of the services set forth in Schedule 1 hereto
(the “Technology Development Services”), DSS shall pay Developer the sum of US $23,000 per month, for the duration of the Term hereof, with
payments to commence on March 1, 2018.
perturbation.changed_text:
1.2. Development Fees. As payment for Developer’s satisfactory performance of the services set forth in Schedule 1 hereto
(the “Technology Development Services”), DSS shall pay Developer the sum of US $23,000 per month, for the first three months of the Term hereof, with
payments to commence on March 1, 2018. Subsequent payments will be determined based on project milestones achieved, as defined and agreed upon by both parties in writing, no later than the 15th of the preceding month.
perturbation.explanation: The original contract states a fixed monthly payment for the duration of the term. The modified clause introduces a condition where payment changes after the first three months and depends on milestones to be defined later. This directly contradicts the fixed payment term, creating ambiguity and potential disputes regarding payment amounts and timing after the initial period.

perturbation.original_text:
2.1. Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date, and shall continue thereafter for a period of
twelve (12) months (the “Initial Term”). The Initial Term shall automatically renew for one-month periods thereafter unless either party provides 30-
days advance notice of termination, unless earlier terminated pursuant to Section 2.2 hereof. For purposes hereof, the Initial Term, together with any
extension or renewal terms, shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as the “Term”.
perturbation.changed_text:
2.1. Term. The initial term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date, and shall continue thereafter for a period of
twelve (12) months (the “Initial Term”). The Initial Term shall automatically renew for one-month periods thereafter unless either party provides 30-
days advance notice of termination, unless earlier terminated pursuant to Section 2.2 hereof. Notwithstanding the preceding sentence, DSS reserves the right to terminate this agreement at any time, with no less than 5 days written notice. For purposes hereof, the Initial Term, together with any
extension or renewal terms, shall hereinafter be collectively referred to as the “Term”.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause states that the contract automatically renews for one month unless a 30 day notice is given. The added sentence introduces a clause that DSS can terminate with 5 days notice. This creates a direct contradiction because it's now unclear what the actual notice period is. It also contradicts that it can be terminated pursuant to section 2.2 only.

perturbation.original_text:
3.2. Developer hereby acknowledges DSS’s claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Improvements, and all associated
goodwill. Nothing in this Agreement or in the performance thereof, or that might otherwise be implied by law, shall operate to grant Developer any
right, title, or interest in or to the Technology or the Improvements. Developer hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may
acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Improvements, along with the goodwill associated therewith. DSS shall have the sole
right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Improvements.
perturbation.changed_text:
3.2. Developer hereby acknowledges DSS’s claim of sole ownership of the Technology, the Improvements, and all associated
goodwill. Nothing in this Agreement or in the performance thereof, or that might otherwise be implied by law, shall operate to grant Developer any
right, title, or interest in or to the Technology or the Improvements, unless specific improvements are jointly invented and patented. In such cases, Developer will retain joint ownership of those specific jointly invented improvements with DSS. Developer hereby assigns and shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may
acquire by operation of law or otherwise in the Technology or Improvements, along with the goodwill associated therewith. DSS shall have the sole
right to, and in its sole discretion may, commence, prosecute or defend, and control any legal action concerning the Technology and Improvements.
perturbation.explanation: The original clause gives sole ownership of improvements to DSS. The added clause specifies that if an improvement is jointly invented and patented, then the developer retains ownership of those. This creates an in-text contradiction about who owns the improvements. The language "shall assign in the future to DSS all rights it may acquire by operation of law" is then contradicted by the previous sentence.
